boat.name: Halcyon
boat.full_description:
'Halcyon' is a Cape Cutter 19, built near Cape Town, South Africa in July 2003. She is a white boat, there are only three others I believe in existence, 'Zest' (Hull 28), 'Sarabella' (Hull 46) and 'Zephyr' (Hull 47).

'Halcyon' has been with the same owner, Simon Head, from new and was picked up from Bursledon in Hampshire. She still has all the original paperwork and was handed over by Nick and Lyndsay Voorhoeve from Cape Yachts personally and rigged up for the first time there. It was during rigging up that Simon had a phone call from Bob Brown, Honnor Marine, saying that he had bought the rights to build the Cape Cutter 19 in the UK at Rochdale. Honnor Marine still build the Cape Cutter 19 in Rochdale and Bob has been an enthusiast for the boat since he took over production in the UK.

'Halcyon' has travelled extensively, visit her website to follow her adventures.
boat.short_description: 'Halcyon' is a Cape Cutter 19 and has been owned from new by Simon Head who took delivery from Nick and Lyndsay Voorhoeve at Bursledon, July 2003. She has been trailer sailed around the UK.
